info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 2:28PM CDT until April 22 at 3:35PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Missouri...
Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County.
Spring River near Waco affecting Jasper County.
Spring River at Carthage affecting Jasper County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Elk River near Tiff City affecting McDonald County.
For the Spring River...including Carthage, Waco, Baxter Springs... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast.
* WHERE...Elk River near Tiff City.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, minor flooding occurs at the gage site. The Cowskin River Floating Public Access Area on the west side of Highway 43 floods. The access road to the RV Park at Herman's Campground two miles upstream from the bridge floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON
